title: Fix membership applications not displaying in admin panel

requirements.summary: Investigate and fix the data flow issue preventing pending membership applications from displaying in the AdminManagementPage
acceptanceCriteria: When a user submits a membership application, it is successfully stored in the backend
The AdminManagementPage displays all pending applications with applicant name, bio, and submission date
Admin users can see and interact with approve/reject buttons for each application
Console logs or debug output confirm data is flowing correctly from backend through usePendingApplications hook to the UI

file_operations.description: Review and enhance the usePendingApplications hook to ensure it properly handles the backend response format. Add comprehensive error handling and logging to trace the data flow from backend to frontend. Verify that the query is enabled correctly based on admin status and actor availability. Ensure the hook properly transforms the backend MembershipApplication[] response into the format expected by the AdminManagementPage component.

Fix the Membership Applications section to properly display pending applications. Verify that the component correctly uses the data from usePendingApplications hook. Ensure proper rendering of application cards showing applicant name, bio, and formatted timestamp. Verify approve/reject button wiring to useApproveApplication and useRejectApplication hooks. Add debug logging to trace received data and rendering state.

requirements.summary: Add error handling and user feedback to the AdminManagementPage Membership Applications section
acceptanceCriteria: Display a clear message when there are no pending applications
Show error messages if the usePendingApplications hook fails
Include loading states while applications are being fetched

file_operations.description: Enhance the Membership Applications section with comprehensive loading, error, and empty state handling. When applicationsLoading is true, display a loading spinner or skeleton. When applicationsError exists, show a user-friendly error message with details. When applications array is empty after successful fetch, display a clear message like 'No pending applications at this time'. Ensure all states are visually distinct and provide appropriate user feedback.
